name: Vincci Capitol Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel - amazing location right on the Gran Via. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and tidy. The Capitol building is iconic, and a feature in itself. Having looked at numerous hotels in Madrid online before deciding on the Vincci Capitol, it was certainly one of the most modern looking, compared to other 3 and 4 star hotels in the Gran Via area that were of a similar price.
reviews.title: Loved it!!
Fantastic Location
reviews.text: When we booked the room, we requested a double room, however having read a number of reviews from people saying they had ended up with two twins pushed together, I emailed the hotel direct to request a double. Their reply stated that they couldn't guarantee it, however when we got there, we were told they had the request and we had a double room.

The room itself was nice - on the side of the hotel so not looking down the Gran Via, but still modern, clean and tidy. And yes, there is only one English TV channel (CNN), but do you really go to Madrid to watch TV in your hotel room?! It has to be said the lighting in the room is unique, and can be temperamental, but it didn't pose too many problems. Also, an added bonus is that each room has its own heating / air conditioning which you can control yourself, and the window can be opened to get fresh air in.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main selling point about the hotel has to be the location: right on the Gran Via and close to all the main attractions of the city centre. Don't forget to visit the roof terrace which offers amazing views across the city, day and night (although sadly no opportunity for a sunset viewing as it is on the wrong side of the building), and take some time to rest your feet in the hotel bar on the third floor, which offers views straight down the Gran Via.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for a short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is contemporary, and high quality, and was ideal for a romantic long weekend break. I would definitely recommend it, more for a break rather than a business trip (whilst there is free wifi in the rooms, there was no desk or working space). If you're going, definitely look around for a discount on the room rate as although it's 4 star, with the poor exchange rate for travellers from the UK, it's probably not worth the full price.
reviews.title: Good value; very nice, modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Vincci Capitol, Madrid and stayed there for a week at the beginning of September 2008. When we checked in we were given a smoking room with no view and we had specifically requested a non-smoking. We went back to reception and asked politely if we could have a non smoking room with a view. We were given room 207 which was fantastic. We could see up and down the Gran Via and the room was spacious. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Lovely Hotel

likes.disliked: — They did not do evening meals

reviews.text: We loved this hotel. It was totally re-done less than a year ago, so everything is new, clean and modern. Our bed was big and comfortable and the "pillow menu" made sure we slept well. And the staff were very kind throughout. For us, the best parts were the bathroom - both a big bathtub and a luxuriously large shower - and the location. Not only is it close to everything, but the movie theater next door hosts all the releases. The new Che movie was feted while were there with lots of red carpets and lights -- and we even saw Benicio del Toro in the hotel bar later that night! Don't forget to check out the solarium and the view deck on the top floors. We will definitely be back at our next chance.
reviews.title: Seeing Stars at the Vincci Capitol

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Vincci Capitol for 5 nights and thought the location was absolutely superb. It was bang in the centre and you can walk to most of the popular tourist sites such as plaza de sol within 5 min. There are a few metro stations within a stone throw from the hotel and the main shopping district starts right on the door step.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

likes.disliked: — No breakfast included, had to pay to use TV facilities.

reviews.text: Dont forget to check out el corte ingles department stores and the FNAC to pick up a Wii FIT, there are 100s in stock.
reviews.title: Good views but your'll pay for them

reviews.text: The hotel features a bar, no restaurant. The bar is only open for about 3 hrs every evening, so dont expect to come back to the hotel for a drink, as it will be closed. It also features a spa which costs over 25euro for 30 min or so treatment. Didnt bother so im not entirely sure about the price, all i know is its expensive.
reviews.title: Great location
Do Not Stay Here Unless You Smoke!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Vinnci Capital as well it's affiliate- Vinnci 66 on my 10 day vacation in Madrid. I would absolutely NOT reccomend staying at either hotel unless you are a chain smoker! Im unsure as to how a previous guest found a non- smoking room as there is no such thing. Cigarette smoke in these hotels is suffocating as they allow smoking in all rooms as well as the first floor and the restaurant. It WILL filter into your room, and if you are like me and hate being involuntarily exposed DO NOT STAY HERE. And FYI, your clothes will smell too- this was particularly frustrating to have clothes that reeked for 10 days. It is in a great central location but there are many other hotels that share this location that are more stringent on smoking.

This hotel is conveniently located on Calle Gran Via just steps from the Callo Metro stop and about a 2 minute walk to Sol. Within 10 minute walk you can reach many major sites like the Plaza Major, Palacio Real, Teatro Real and Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza. In the immediate vicinity of the hotel, there are a couple of huge movie theatres, lots of restaurants, department stores and cafes. I could not find a grocery store anywhere nearby. This area of town seems to be the main, modern, commercial hub.
reviews.title: Good Quality Contemporary Hotel

reviews.text: I had a double room on the 8th floor with a large walk out balcony (excellent sunset views of the city). On the surface the hotel has a contemporary, style with clean lines and a rich but subdued colour scheme. I actually liked having the hardwood flooring instead carpeting for a change. The hotel is relatively new, so most things still look fresh and function as they should. A closer inspection shows some cost-saving choices, like a plastic wash basin and thin wood veneers. However, these do not detract from the look and feel. I had a shower but no bath, but I prefer this anyway. The shower stall was large and had a wonderful textured stone floor and walls and a huge, high-mounted shower head. The room could have been slightly larger and I think a coffee/tea maker should be provided.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was very friendly and efficient. Because I was exhausted the first night of arrival, I tried to order room service - but be warned, unlike at the front desk, not much English is spoken elsewhere in the hotel. That was not a big deal as it forced me to practice my Spanish.
reviews.title: Comfortable but typical european hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this is a good hotel in a convenient location. I don't think it is quite a 4 star hotel. It is definitely better than 3 stars however, so I'll give it the benefit of the doubt. While I liked the hotel, I think next time I'd prefer to stay in Old Madrid south of Sol.
reviews.title: Brilliant!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Vincci Capitol and were pretty satisfied with everything - friendly service at the reception and during breakfast (evenings in the bar as well), clean and modern designed rooms and perfectly situated in the center of Madrid so one can reach almost all tourist attractions (including nice tapas bars and pubs/discos) by foot. For a short city trip I can highly recommend the Vincci Capitol hotel.
reviews.title: An excellent design hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location close to metro, gran via and shops would recommend to anyone
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I stayed now the third time at that hotel. I loved it already, because of its very central location, but the last time, I could reserve their junior-suite on the top floor, on their 12th floor.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY SENSATIONAL VIEW

reviews.text: The room is very nice and very spacious, modern and the view is absolutely sensational. There is a terrace, from where you can over look the entire city. The Kings palace and the hudge park behind are so close, wonderful. The staff was very friendly helpful and efficient, what else could we ask for.
reviews.title: Just OK but not really!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything else, shopping, bars, restaurants is just a few steps away, Plaza Mayor, Sol, everything you wish to see in Madrid, just get out of the hotel and walk it. The Metro station, Callao, just next to the hotel.
reviews.title: Not Bad!

description: In the heart of Madrid: the Hotel Vincci Capitol, located right on the Gran Vía and Plaza Callao. It is a building symbolic of Madrid’s “Art Deco” civil architecture. The ground floor houses one of the most famous cinemas on Madrid’s Gran Vía, Cines Capitol.
